description.narrative: Syftet är att stärka parlamentet i T-L genom att bygga kapacitet med parlamentsledamöter för att analysera, debattera och godkänna nationella budgetar och att ha tillsyn över regeringens politik, program och utgifter, inklusive jämställdhetsdimensionen. Att bistå sekretariatet med att förbättra administrationen och riksdagens verksamhet. Samt förbättra öppenheten och allmänhetens deltagande, särskilt ungdomar.

The aim is to strengthen the parliament in T-L by building capacity with members of paliament to analyze, debate and approve national budgets and to have oversight of government policies, programmes and expenditure, including gender dimension. To assist the secretariat to improve administration and parliament operations. As well as improve transparancy and the participation of the public, especially youth.

description.narrative:
General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2015Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: The project UNDP Strengthening Parlimentary Democracy in Timor-Leste main purpose is to strengthen the basic functions of a parliament by educating elected parliamentarians and officials in their respective functions in relation to the laws and regulations, budget, democratic representativeness, equality, openness and transparency.
Output 1 Legislative support. Key results, new structure of parliament established with 7 standing committees. Directorate of research services established. 10 legal drafters and 3 secotrial analysts trained.
Output 2 Oversight support Key results, mandatory quartely reporting of State Budget execution initiated. 20+ oversight reports disseminated by committees in 2014 (up from 1 in 2013). 4 trained budget analysts working with committess. Parliament scruriny of public accounts initiated.
Output 3 Strengthened parliamentary administration and secretariat function. Key results, manual in parliament adminstration was edited and published. Handbook form MPs. Transcription unit established and 15 transcribers trained (200+ plenary sessions transcribed since 2013). 122 out 139 full time secretariat staff on board in 2014, as a result of 5 rounds of merit-based recruitments
Output 4 Support democratic representation, transparency and accessibility Key results, website of national parliament launched. Public consultations initiated as part of the law-making process (187 in 2014). Friday and weekend designated for party bench work and visiting constituents.
Output 5 Gender mainstreaming Key results, gender analysis and institutionalised as part of State budget approval process. Centre for gender equality (CEGEN) established. Group of women parliamentarians of Timor-Leste (GMPTL) established.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
